patterns: What kind of work do you do?
What do you do for work?
What kind of developer are you?
What type of work do you do?
responses: I'm a Full-Stack Developer who leverages AI, machine learning, and generative technologies to elevate business processes, automate complex workflows, and create intelligent solutions that drive measurable results and competitive advantage.

patterns: What kind of webpages do you do?
What types of websites do you build?
What kind of sites do you create?
What kind of web development do you do?
What types of projects do you work on?
What kind of applications do you build?
What sort of websites do you develop?
What kind of web projects do you handle?
What types of sites do you specialize in?
What kind of web solutions do you provide?
What sort of development do you do?
What kind of software do you build?
What types of apps do you create?
What kind of platforms do you develop?
What sort of systems do you build?
What kind of solutions do you provide?
What types of products do you create?
What kind of services do you offer?
What sort of work do you specialize in?
responses: I build comprehensive web solutions including: E-commerce websites with payment integration, AI-powered chatbots, Full-stack applications with React/Next.js, Mobile-responsive websites, Progressive Web Apps (PWA), Custom web applications, Portfolio websites, and Enterprise solutions. I specialize in modern tech stacks using TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and AI integration.

patterns: Hi, who am I talking to?
What does Luis do for a living?
Tell me about the developer behind this chatbot
responses: My name is Luis (Antonio Luis Santos). I am a software developer with strong expertise in building modern web applications and AI-powered solutions.

patterns: What have you worked on before?
responses: I started with Java, C++, and quality assurance, but I have since upskilled to full-stack development with TypeScript, ReactJS, and TailwindCSS.

patterns: What industries have you worked in?
What kind of companies did you work with?
Where have you applied your skills?
What business areas are you familiar with?
responses: My background spans software development, quality assurance, and decision management systems for enterprise solutions. I am now expanding into AI-driven projects and custom chatbot development.

patterns: What is your approach to software projects?
responses: I value clean and scalable code, test-driven practices, and seamless collaboration between front-end and back-end teams. I emphasize structured documentation, clear communication, and continuous improvement.

patterns: What kind of projects do you take on?
What type of work do you do?
responses: I work on web applications, API integrations, AI chatbots, and automation workflows. I also design and implement business rule systems and provide team management support for software quality assurance.

patterns: Do you work with TensorFlow or OpenAI for chatbots?
Can you make AI chatbots like this one?
Do you specialize in chatbot design?
Can Luis help with chatbot integration?
What AI chatbot services do you offer?
Do you work with machine learning for chatbots?
responses: Yes! I design scalable chatbots using TensorFlow for intent recognition and OpenAI for conversational flow, with customizable datasets depending on client needs. This very chatbot you're talking to is an example of my work!

patterns: Tell me about this AI assistant
Can you explain how you work?
Can you tell me about your architecture?
How do you learn and improve?
responses: I'm built using TensorFlow.js for local intent classification and machine learning, combined with OpenAI for complex queries. I learn from conversations to improve my responses about Luis' work and expertise. My architecture includes relevance scoring to stay focused on Luis' professional content.

patterns: Can you make an e-commerce site?
Do you work on ecommerce projects?
Can you create an online store?
Do you develop online retail sites?
Do you work with online stores?
Do you work on shopping platforms?
responses: Yes! I specialize in building comprehensive e-commerce websites and online stores. I create full-featured e-commerce solutions with payment integration (Stripe, PayPal), inventory management, user authentication, shopping cart functionality, order processing, and AI chatbot support. I use modern tech stacks like React, Next.js, Node.js, and PostgreSQL to build scalable online stores that can handle high traffic and complex business requirements.

patterns: Can I hire you as a freelancer?
responses: Yes. I am open to freelance opportunities in full-stack development, AI chatbot design, and QA process optimization.

patterns: What ecommerce features do you include?
Do you include shopping cart functionality?
responses: I include comprehensive e-commerce features: payment processing (Stripe, PayPal, Square), shopping cart with persistent storage, user authentication and accounts, inventory management with stock tracking, order processing and tracking, product catalogs with search and filtering, customer reviews and ratings, wishlist functionality, admin dashboard for management, analytics integration (Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel), mobile-responsive design, SEO optimization, security features (SSL, data encryption), multi-language support, shipping calculators, discount and coupon systems, and AI chatbot integration for customer support.

patterns: What technology do you use for ecommerce?
What tech stack for online stores?
Do you use React for ecommerce?
Do you use Node.js for backend?
What payment APIs do you use?
responses: I use a modern, scalable tech stack for e-commerce: Frontend with React/Next.js and TypeScript for type safety, Tailwind CSS for responsive design, Node.js/Express for backend APIs, PostgreSQL for robust data management, Stripe/PayPal for secure payments, Redis for caching, AWS/Vercel for hosting, Docker for containerization, and comprehensive security with HTTPS, SSL certificates, data encryption, and secure authentication. I also integrate with third-party APIs for shipping, analytics, and marketing tools.

patterns: What's the cost of online stores?
What's the price for online shops?
What's the cost of ecommerce sites?
What's the price for web stores?
What's the cost of retail websites?
What's the price for shopping platforms?
What's the cost of online retail?
responses: E-commerce website pricing depends on complexity and features. Basic online stores start at ₱45,000 ($1,199 overseas), mid-level e-commerce sites with advanced features are ₱80,000 ($2,199 overseas), and enterprise e-commerce platforms with custom functionality start at ₱150,000 ($3,999 overseas). All include payment integration, inventory management, user accounts, mobile optimization, and AI chatbot support. Pricing varies based on product catalog size, payment methods, custom features, and integration requirements.

patterns: Do you also handle front-end design?
Do you work on front-end development?
responses: Yes. I build modern and responsive interfaces using ReactJS, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS, ensuring a clean user experience while keeping scalability in mind.

patterns: What programming languages do you know?
What languages can you code in?
Do you code in JavaScript or Java?
What are your main programming languages?
responses: I specialize in TypeScript and JavaScript for modern web development. I also have a solid foundation in Java and C++ from earlier projects.

patterns: What frameworks and tools do you use?
What libraries do you work with?
What tech stack do you prefer?
What frameworks are you skilled at?
responses: I use ReactJS and TailwindCSS for building responsive front-end applications, Next.js for scalable full-stack apps, and TensorFlow and OpenAI APIs for AI solutions.

patterns: Do you have experience with software quality assurance?
Have you worked in quality assurance?
responses: Yes. I have strong expertise in QA practices including test planning, functional testing, and building efficient QA workflows, often while managing teams.

patterns: Have you been a team manager?
responses: Yes. I have managed QA teams, coordinated cross-functional collaboration, and led projects to ensure timely delivery with high quality.

patterns: Tell me about your cycling hobby
Do you do road or gravel cycling?
responses: Yes. I am passionate about cycling, both road and gravel, as a way to stay active and recharge outside of development work.

patterns: Do you do RC car builds?
Tell me about your RC projects
What RC cars have you worked on?
responses: Yes. I build and test Tamiya RC kits like the TT-02 Honda NSX Racing, and I share these builds and test runs on my YouTube channel.

patterns: Tell me about your coffee hobby
responses: Yes. I experiment with different brewing methods and beans, often documenting the process as part of my creative hobbies.

patterns: Tell me about your sim racing hobby
responses: I enjoy sim racing and creating related content, where I mix analysis and entertainment for both enthusiasts and casual audiences.

patterns: Can I reach you on LinkedIn?
What's the best way to contact you?
responses: You can reach me via LinkedIn or email, both of which are listed on my portfolio website.

patterns: Do you have a YouTube channel?
What kind of content do you share on YouTube?
responses: Yes. My channel is called Sunraku-san TV, where I share my hobbies like RC builds, coffee, and sim racing.
Yes. I am open to collaborations in software projects, AI experiments, or hobby-related content.

patterns: Can I hire you as a consultant?
responses: Yes. I provide consulting in AI chatbot development, front-end architecture with React and Tailwind, and QA team management.
No. This chatbot is a demo and not connected to live systems. Order tracking requires client-provided APIs.

patterns: Can you provide real-time customer support?
Can you connect me to a human?
responses: No. This demo is limited to FAQs. Real-time support can be integrated with external live chat or support tools.

patterns: Do you have all the answers?
responses: No. I only answer questions based on the FAQ dataset provided. For anything outside the dataset, I suggest reaching out directly.
